quotes.quote: The refreshing pleasure from the first view of nature, after the pain of illness, and the confinement of a sick-chamber, is above the conceptions, as well as the descriptions, of those in health.
quotes.author: Ann Radcliffe

quotes.quote: Nature is just enough; but men and women must comprehend and accept her suggestions.
quotes.author: Antoinette Brown Blackwell

quotes.quote: In all things of nature there is something of the marvelous.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: The materials of wealth are in the earth, in the seas, and in their natural and unaided productions.
quotes.author: Daniel Webster

quotes.quote: I would feel more optimistic about a bright future for man if he spent less time proving that he can outwit Nature and more time tasting her sweetness and respecting her seniority.
quotes.author: E. B. White

quotes.quote: Mountains inspire awe in any human person who has a soul. They remind us of our frailty, our unimportance, of the briefness of our span upon this earth. They touch the heavens, and sail serenely at an altitude beyond even the imaginings of a mere mortal.
quotes.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.quote: I believe in God, only I spell it Nature.
quotes.author: H. G. Wells

quotes.quote: Adapt or perish, now as ever, is nature's inexorable imperative.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.quote: Nature is wont to hide herself.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: One cannot fix one's eyes on the commonest natural production without finding food for a rambling fancy.
quotes.author: Scott Westerfeld

quotes.quote: It's amazing how quickly nature consumes human places after we turn our backs on them. Life is a hungry thing.
quotes.author: Tennessee Williams

quotes.quote: A vacuum is a hell of a lot better than some of the stuff that nature replaces it with.
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.quote: After you have exhausted what there is in business, politics, conviviality, and so on - have found that none of these finally satisfy, or permanently wear - what remains? Nature remains.
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.quote: You must not know too much or be too precise or scientific about birds and trees and flowers and watercraft; a certain free-margin, and even vagueness - ignorance, credulity - helps your enjoyment of these things.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Nature does require her times of preservation.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote:
Where the bee sucks, there suck I:
In a cowslip's bell I lie;
There I couch when owls do cry.
On the bat's back I do fly
After summer merrily.
Merrily, merrily shall I live now
Under the blossom that hangs on the bough.
quotes.author: Zeno

quotes.quote: The goal of life is living in agreement with nature.
